agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Higher Education TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, March 20, 2019 PLACE: E1.014 CHAIR: Rep. Chris Turner HB 66 Romero, Jr. Relating to student success-based funding recommendations for certain continuing workforce education courses offered by public junior colleges. HB 476 Howard Relating to certain duties of public institutions of higher education and the Department of State Health Services regarding policies on the use of epinephrine auto-injectors by public institutions of higher education. HB 730 Hernandez | et al. Relating to exempting certain homeless individuals from the payment of tuition and fees at public institutions of higher education. HB 809 Thierry Relating to measures to assist students enrolled at public institutions of higher education who are homeless or who were formerly in foster care. HB 1277 Perez Relating to authorizing a wellness and success center fee at the University of Houston-Downtown. HB 1482 Lozano Relating to the offense of hazing. HB 1516 Coleman Relating to the intercollegiate athletics fee at Texas Southern University; authorizing the continued imposition of a fee. HB 1702 Howard Relating to services provided for students at public institutions of higher education who were formerly in foster care. HB 1891 Stucky Relating to an exemption from the assessment requirements of the Texas Success Initiative for students who achieve certain scores on certain high school equivalency examinations. HB 2000 Turner, Chris | et al. Relating to authorizing the issuance of revenue bonds to fund capital projects at public institutions of higher education. HB 2140 Neave Relating to creating an electronic application system for state student financial assistance. HB 2261 Walle Relating to the physician education loan repayment program. HB 2680 Schaefer Relating to the student recreational facility fee at The University of Texas at Tyler. HB 2709 Frullo Relating to authorization for the sale of certain Texas Tech University property. HB 2718 Turner, Chris Relating to authorizing an increase in the student union fee at The University of Texas at Arlington. HB 2867 Metcalf Relating to the creation of the Sam Houston State University College of Osteopathic Medicine. HB 2963 Clardy Relating to the conveyance of certain state forest land in Cherokee County under the control of the board of regents of The Texas A&M University System. HB 2968 Frullo Relating to procedures for the issuance of certain private activity bonds. HB 3011 Turner, Chris Relating to requiring the Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board to provide to a school district certain information used in determining academic accountability ratings for the district. HB 3042 Turner, Chris Relating to the Texas college work-study program and to establishing a program for the off-campus employment of certain students at public or private institutions of higher education. HB 3266 Raney Relating to fees charged to students enrolled at component institutions of The Texas A&M University System. *Bills may be heard out of order at the discretion of the chair. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
